reviews.review: To be honest, we've all probably watched The Emoji Movie thousands of times. Where? During commercial breaks on tv. This film is one big commercial. They literally play Candy Crush and Just Dance! They also fly on the Twitter bird, go through the sound waves of Spotify, enter the Cloud through Dropbox, etc. The characters are forgettable. The has been told so many other times, in much better movies (Inside Out, The Lego Movie). The jokes are cringey as hell. There are so many problems with this movie, that the only reason why it gets a half star is because the animation is not bad (although it's not particularly unique either). This movie isn't like The Room, where it's so bad but so enjoyable at the same time, and therefore is remembered as a classic today. This movie should be forgotten completely. Unbelievable that this movie came from a company that made good movies in the past. Even more unbelievable that they shelved the Popeye movie to make this film.
Not a joke I really liked it but it's a copycat but the lesson is good so congrats your first 5 stars.

the good: the animation. it probably looks like one of the best-looking animations that I've seen.
The Bad: The plot. It just feels like a 90-minute ad for apps.
The Ugly: Patrick Stewart=POOP.
All in all, the Emoji Movie sucks. The film has no reason to exist, & no reason to be seen. But the full star is for the animation. It's actually good-looking.
SKIP @ ALL COSTS.
This was one of the greatest movies I have ever seen.

Ok...what the living hell is this?
Best: Probably the animation. It actually isn't the worst, and the bright colors gives it a more child-like appeal. And I thought that making the "old-school" emoticons senior citizens (like :0) was quite clever.
Bad: That plot. It's like Wreck It Ralph, Inside Out, and The Lego Movie mixed with emojis and gave birth to a disgusting baby. The character literally gets threatened just because he makes a different face. Huh? I expected something bad, but I remembered what I thought about The Lego Movie and decided to give it a chance. The jokes were very tired (mostly about the poop emoji), and the characters are actually kind of irritating in a way. 
WTF?: I'm sorry if I sound immature for this, but HOW DO YOU PLAY "JUST DANCE" ON A PHONE? There were some very big holes in the plot, and I'm not exactly into the voices in the characters. They all just seem tired and sleepy.

Overall: Huge nope. If you see this movie, take two steps back each time.

When you think of classic movies,what do you think of?Mulan?The emperors new groove?Do you really want to call this a classic?Do you really want to show your kids this?No.Remember that it takes an entire team to make this.It takes a group of people to sit down and say "this is a great idea."

Despite trying to be different from the rest of the movies, the only thing different is the superficial, the only fact that no one could think of a movie of the emojis, however, it is only in the superficial, and that level of script reaches be very heavy to compare it to other movies. 6/20

The very best animated flim for kids in a while. Great action great comedy and the romance is just heartwarming. the references to kids and social media today is the best. This movie also has the best message of have an emoji help save your relationship with a girl and I thought that was a wonderful lesson! Grat film for children of all ages and maybe adults could enjoy it too! Definitely Recommend
